text:
Are you sometimes wondering when to use
'good' and when to use 'well'?

Are you unsure whether you should say
'real nice' or 'really nice'?

Then join me in this lesson for a review
of English adverbs and adjectives.

This lesson is sponsored by Lingoda
online language school, which is a

provider of live English lessons with
qualified native teachers.
More information about Lingoda at the end of the video.

Hello and welcome everyone, this is Minoo
at Anglo-Link.

In this lesson, we're going to review
adjectives and adverbs, and look at some
common mistakes that you might be making with them.

We'll end the lesson with an exercise so
you can check your understanding.
By the end of the lesson you will have a clear idea of how to use adjectives and

adverbs, and how to avoid some common
mistakes. So, when you ready let's begin.

Many of you have asked me how you can
improve your English speaking and

listening skills. In my experience, the most
efficient way to do this is by taking
private lessons with a native speaker.

I recently took a Spanish lesson with

secondly, all the teachers are fully qualified native speakers.
And finally, they offer certification based CEFR levels from A1 to C2, which allows you to set targets and
